intro: Micromeria graeca subsp. tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved micromeria, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
